intro: Spermacoce sarcophylla, commonly known as the purple starbursts or purple rattlebox, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling starbursts. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of many members of the Rubiaceae family. Spermacoce sarcophylla is often found in woodland and scrub habitats, growing in well-drained soils.
